metadata.Title: CVE-2014-2331 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Check_MK 1.2.2p2, 1.2.2p3, and 1.2.3i5 allows remote authenticated users to execute arbitrary Python code via a crafted rules.mk file in a snapshot. NOTE: this can be exploited by remote attackers by leveraging CVE-2014-2330.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-2331` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

check-mk-agent - 1.2.2p3-1
check-mk-agent-logwatch - 1.2.2p3-1
check-mk-config-icinga - 1.2.2p3-1
check-mk-config-nagios3 - 1.2.2p3-1
check-mk-livestatus - 1.2.2p3-1
check-mk-multisite - 1.2.2p3-1
check-mk-server - 1.2.2p3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: check-mk package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.2p3-1').
